While it takes a bit of a grind to get the right perks for your build, on either side - it's a pretty accessible game, with a high skill cap and a lengthy learning curve. There's a lot to learn & overcome, even hundreds of hours in. Once you look past the sporadic bugs & queue times, there's a solid design here that continues to get better over time.
I love this game so much but my only critique is lack of accessibility for color-blind gamers. They really need to prioritize this!

THIS GAME IS GREAT.
Matchmaking is GREAT, always with your own skill level and never with ranks way above you. 
Super balanced perks that are GREAT! No perks make the game broken or make the game super one sided.
But the community, let me tell you just how GREAT they are. If you want to play with your friends the  killer will be so happy when  you're SWF that they tell you in endgame chat, and if you're killer that does their role then guess what survivors jump with glee and congratulate you for stopping them.  this game is just great.

Dont buy this game, matchmaking is trash, one sided and shit attitudes make it not enjoyable.

I like the detail put into the game's graphics to make it horrific. I also liked the mechanics that survivors face to be more than just a game of tag. Cross play makes the experience so much better with other players!

Although fustrating at many times, this game has been very fun over the years. Playing survivor for new players is quite scary and stressful, but turns into a more strategy and chase based game as you grow skill with it. Killer is very fun to decimate the survivor team with, although still stressful at times. Would definitely recommend for those looking for multiplayer horror genre with a dedicated fanbase.

whenever I play a game with cheryl mason, I get a massive boner

After 15 months I feel like I've seen enough to finally decide to change my review to negative.

The core gameplay mechanics are pretty good and the game could be very fun, but the developers absolutely have no idea what they are doing and this shows in nearly every decision they make.

The game was at a point where survivors needed another objective to keep games from being over in 5 minutes, and the developers decided that we should give the killer another objective (boons) because, hell, they don't have enough to do?

They have utterly failed to address the toxic nature of the playerbase.  The players are partly to blame, but BHVR enables the behavior.  The in-game report system is a placebo.

They reworked the matchmaking system to create more competitive games, in a game that's not competitive -- and it still utterly fails to actually create close matches.  SBMM is a horribly broken solution to a problem that didn't exist.

They give us a preview of upcoming content (PTBs) then ignore literally ALL of the feedback given by veteran players.

They can't release a single patch without introducing absolutely ridiculous bugs.

There are huge, year-old balance issues that the community has been pointing out nonstop that the developers completely ignore.

An update cannot fix these problems, because a software patch can't fix developers not understanding their game or giving a damn about their players' experience.  It is a shame that the 4v1 game with the most potential is this egregiously mismanaged.
